name: epicurus
text: One of my favourites of all time. Particularly the " 'Star Wars' right here at home!" line. The news will so totally do that, all missing the basic premise of a movie or show in order to tie it in to a dog getting hit by a car.

name: catachresis
text:
Beat me to it.
"Ever seen Die Hard? Well, you might wish you had, as we expose the TERRIBLE SANITARY STANDARDS OF NEW YORK ITALIAN RESTAURANTS"

name: pa_ass_nts
text: The Australian current affairs program Today Tonight once did that with Harry Potter and creative accounting.

name: farqussus
text: If there's one thing Ausralians do well, it's ripping off FOX News Fear.

name: farqussus
text: that, and not spelling Australia properly.

name: hipjiverobot
text: He was referring to Ausralia, a country that only rich people know about.

name: crumpetsandtea
text: every single comment of yours, hipjiverobot, i stare and stare at that damn potato and for the life of me i cant figure out DOES IT MOVE OR NOT!

name: hipjiverobot
text:
It only moves if you are worthy.

So your confusion would mean you're borderline, I guess.

name: tekende
text: POTATO MOVEMENT IS UNTRACEABLE MOVEMENT

name: crumpetsandtea
text:
today, i join the great potato movement.

today.
is the day.
for change.


POTATO MOVEMENT.

name: hipjiverobot
text: Change you can believe in.

name: crumpetsandtea
text: Potatobama

name: saint
text: I'd vote for that.

name: spicyponyhead
text: Only here on Assetbar would I happily stare at an icon of a potato for a minute or two, to figure out if it moves.

name: spicyponyhead
text: p.s. it moves!

name: hipjiverobot
text: You may want to get that checked out.

name: crumpetsandtea
text: The movement of the potato is more complicated than it seems.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: The potato does not move. It is the sky that moves around the potato.

name: tollschaft
text: YOU LIE

name: spicyponyhead
text: Or I smoke a lot of pot. Your call.

name: zaratustra
text: and yet it moves

name: dissembly
text:
YOU just wasted thirty seconds of my life!

...can i have some pot?

name: katethegreat
text:
Ausralia is the eBay Platinum Reserve of countries.

All getting on Orbitz and typing in WHAT'S THE BEST COUNTRY YOU GOT

name: clintisiceman
text: Dogg, Fox News was invented by an Australian.

name: boredom_man
text: It is a conspiracy by Australian conservatives to make American conservatives look bad due to anti-environmentalism propaganda thus Australian conservatives will get elected the King of the Playhouse.

name: theguitarhero
text: Oh no boredom_man was assassinated.

name: epicurus
text: "With all the magic flying about from Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, Australian financial firm Laxtorn-Powers has been performing some wizardry of its own... in the form of insider trading and misleading profit announcements! More at Eleven (mate)"

name: epicurus
text: God dammit, why does your comment have to be so much better than mine?

name: whitey
text: Beef is entirely too susceptible to this kind of hype.

name: ferdinand
text:
maybe he's NOT SUSCEPTIBLE ENOUGH!

no, no. you're right. poor guy.

name: zefiel
text: Woah, woah, someone back me up. Did this strip change from the original post? I remember it as picturing Beef completely unfazed by the news, giving it more relevance to the alt text "It's a question the newspapers monday". I don't remember seeing Beef THIS agitated. (which IS in character, so maybe that was the reason of the change)

name: epicurus
text: Can't say as i remember that, though I am pretty sure I HAVE seen small changes creep into strips that make me doubt my sanity (usually alt text)

name: deancain29
text: I have noticed this too! does onstad go back and tinker with stuff. helluva way to keep me occupied.

name: ttagxamm
text: UP NExT: ACHE- WHAT? Study shows popular webcomic possible cause of memory lapses and sudden onset dementia!

name: stuart
text: You might have planted this idea in my head, but I remember this too.

name: i_love_kate
text:
Depends how long ago you're talking about. I actually saved this comic to my hard drive back in November '06, and it matches what's currently up.

Maybe you're just crazy-insane.

name: i_love_kate
text:
NO, BBCODE, WHY.

Don't laugh at me! I was once like you!

name: rothenbergxxx
text: Ha ha ha, experts in Dallas, WOULD say that.

name: cailetshadow
text: I was thinking the same thing. Actually I think most of this news is pseudo-true.

name: stereo
text:
It's true in that it has been reported by real news agencies.

I'm not sure "debunked" is the right word for what happened to these stories, but it's close.

name: mckayle
text: If someone were to ask me how I live my life, I might point them right here.

name: deancain29
text: pure genius

name: aarongstock
text: Bias! Experts who say school's not a must were denied a chance to respond.

name: ixmucane
text:
Dictionary.com > 'papillae'
Because I'm pretty sure I don't want to accidently see a picture of one.

name: heccibiggs
text:
To be honest, that's better than what I was imagining. It put the word "papillón" into my head, French for "butterfly" (unless I'm wrong, which is a very real possibility).

As I have a horrific (and incredibly irrational) fear of moths and butterflies, this nearly made me want to throw up.

name: aelindil
text: Oh my lord, I thought I was the only one who was afraid of moths.  This is either reassuring or disturbing, and I do not know which.

name: heccibiggs
text:
No, it's great! It means there's someone else who doesn't think of me as a total loser weirdo!

Ugh, aren't they so nasty? Why do they have to move like that? Yeeeggghh I'm getting all shuddery just thinking about them now.

name: aelindil
text: I think it's mostly their whole erratic motion thing that freaks me out.  You never know where they are going to fly and it's incredibly disturbing.

name: corpsey
text: And they're made of dust. Actual dust. You crush them and there's no substance there!

name: tibcoolbreeze
text:
You can stand to touch them?

They look fragile, but at the same time, there wings look so... cloth-y.

name: featurelessvoid
text: And they taste so sour .

name: cpnglxynchos
text: a user named 'corpsey' would have made this comment..

name: spinynorman
text:
Nicole Kidman is terrified of butterflies.

Truth.

name: heccibiggs
text: Me and Nicole have so much in common. She has red hair, I have red hair. She fears butterflies, I fear butterflies. Well that's basically it. But thanks to your little factoid, the things I have in common with Nicole Kidman just doubled.

name: soticoto
text:
Also you're both female?

... Besides, look on the bright side. You might be afraid of butterflies, but I'm afraid of any body of water larger than a bath-tub.

name: charchar
text: If it's on his tongue, it's a lingual pappila, which is just a taste bud It might be sort of gross, especially three-inchers. Lingual papillae are just taste buds. They look like bumps, generally pink but the owner might have had such as a Slurpee; I don't know, I'm not here to judge.

name: charchar
text: Also, comes from the Latin word for teat or nipple . Doctors saw them as boobs on your tongue. Isn't etymology fun times?

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i almost when to school for etymology. everyone thought i meant entymology and i got scared.

imagining studying large pictures of bugs freaks me out. (yes, miller moths, gross.)

even this comment is terrible.

TERRIBLE!!

name: terribleman
text: Three inch tongue tits and not a single chubby in two years???

name: epicurus
text: Also, I live in the eastern part of Toronto - so hopefully those beetles missed my place on their way to the states.

name: c_dizzle
text: I hope to god they're going to miss us in So Cal, too...i have enough problems with mosquitoes flying around my ears to worry about an egg-in-your-ear motha.

name: crumpetsandtea
text:
i just realised. i LIVE in north toronto!
and this is about 8 months after originally reading this strip.

oh. my. god.
webcomics really do cause memory loss.

name: senatorexlax
text: EVERYBODY PANIC

name: varnish
text: Still one of my favorites. I was just readin' the news, and turns out that, yep, horrible things are still happening everywhere, and there's not a damn thing anyone can do about it.

name: howl
text: Wait a minute, the first one is actually true

name: andersmn
text: Not just that - a recent journal article I read for a class described how glucose and artificial sweet tastants increase the number of glucose channels in the gut lumen, increasing uptake of glucose.  So, the more artificial sugar you eat, the more you are susceptible to glucose absorption.

name: howl
text: craaazy!

name: mr_lostman28
text: Panel 4: in which we see Beef's TV flip spontaneously between Kuramota Bike Shop Ad, Fox News, and Your Local Nightly "Lighter Sides of News"

name: s1rnight
text: That television is relentless.

name: puguglypress
text: "Star Wars" was one of the achewood moments that made me snort out loud.

name: dallovich
text: The west Virginia coal miner line is a cool subtle nod towards Nice Pete's upbringing.

name: sevenslashfour
text: Life.

name: nice-on-water
text: ain't that just the way

name: dybrar
text: Beef's expression of captivated horror in panel 5 is so well conveyed.
